metadata.title: CVE-2015-8853 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The (1) S_reghop3, (2) S_reghop4, and (3) S_reghopmaybe3 functions inregexec.c in Perl before 5.24.0 allow context-dependent attackers to causea denial of service (infinite loop) via crafted utf-8 data, as demonstratedby "a\x80."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8853` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcgi-fast-perl - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
libperl5.18 - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
perl - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
perl-base - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
perl-debug - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
perl-modules - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: perl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4').
